userProperties.name: Source
userProperties.value: @{concat('v0.jsonld?', concat('sources=', activity('Lookup parameters').output.firstRow.sources), '&', concat('elements=', activity('Lookup parameters').output.firstRow.elements), '&', concat('referencetime=', subtractFromTime(utcnow(), add(item(), 1), 'Month', 'yyyy-MM'), '/', subtractFromTime(utcnow(), item(), 'Month', 'yyyy-MM')))}

source(output(

		CountryRegion as string,
		StateProvince as string,
		City as string,
		Reseller as string,
		BusinessType as string,
		ResellerId as string,
		ResellerKey as integer

	store: 'synapse',

		ResellerId,

	),

	),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: false,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: false) ~> SelectReseller
SelectReseller select(mapColumn(
		ChannelTypeName = BusinessType
	),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: false,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: false) ~> PreSKSelectChannelType
PreSKSelectChannelType aggregate(groupBy(ChannelTypeName),
	Count = count(1)) ~> Deduplicated1PreSKSelectChannelType
Deduplicated1PreSKSelectChannelType select(mapColumn(
		ChannelTypeName
	),

	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: false) ~> SelectDeduplicated1PreSKSelectChannelType
TargetChannelType aggregate(groupBy(ChannelTypeId),
	ChannelTypeName = last(ChannelTypeName)) ~> Deduplicated1TargetChannelType

		ChannelTypeId
	),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: false,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: false) ~> SelectDeduplicated1TargetChannelType

		TarChannelTypeName = ChannelTypeName,
		TarChannelTypeId = ChannelTypeId
	),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: false,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: false) ~> SelectTarSelectDeduplicated1TargetChannelType
SelectDeduplicated1PreSKSelectChannelType, SelectTarSelectDeduplicated1TargetChannelType join(ChannelTypeName === TarChannelTypeName,
	joinType:'left',
	matchType:'exact',
	ignoreSpaces: false,
	broadcast: 'auto')~> JoinSelectTarSelectDeduplicated1TargetChannelType
JoinSelectTarSelectDeduplicated1TargetChannelType filter(isNull(TarChannelTypeId)) ~> FilterInsertChannelType
FilterInsertChannelType select(mapColumn(
		ChannelTypeName
	),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: false,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: false) ~> InsertChannelType
InsertChannelType keyGenerate(output(Sk_ChannelTypeId as long),
	startAt: 1L,
	stepValue: 1L) ~> SkChannelType
SelectTarSelectDeduplicated1TargetChannelType aggregate(Max_TarChannelTypeId = max(toInteger(TarChannelTypeId)) + 0) ~> AggregatedSelectTarSelectDeduplicated1TargetChannelType
AggregatedSelectTarSelectDeduplicated1TargetChannelType derive(Max_TarChannelTypeId = iif(isNull(Max_TarChannelTypeId),0,Max_TarChannelTypeId)) ~> MaxSelectTarSelectDeduplicated1TargetChannelType

	joinType:'cross',
	matchType:'exact',
	ignoreSpaces: false,
	broadcast: 'auto')~> JoinMaxSelectTarSelectDeduplicated1TargetChannelType
JoinMaxSelectTarSelectDeduplicated1TargetChannelType derive(ChannelTypeId = Sk_ChannelTypeId + Max_TarChannelTypeId) ~> DerivedChannelType

		ChannelTypeId

	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: false) ~> PostSkChannelType

	),

	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: false) ~> SelectTarUnionUpdateSelectDeduplicated1PreSKSelectChannelType

	joinType:'left',
	matchType:'exact',
	ignoreSpaces: false,
	broadcast: 'auto')~> JoinSelectTarUnionUpdateSelectDeduplicated1PreSKSelectChannelType
JoinSelectTarUnionUpdateSelectDeduplicated1PreSKSelectChannelType select(mapColumn(

		ChannelTypeId = TarChannelTypeId
	),
	skipDuplicateMapInputs: false,
	skipDuplicateMapOutputs: false) ~> FinalChannelType

	ChannelTypeName = last(ChannelTypeName)) ~> ChannelType

-- Create your Credential for the External Data Source
CREATE DATABASE SCOPED CREDENTIAL WorkspaceIdentity
WITH IDENTITY = 'Managed Identity'

-- Create External Data Source
CREATE EXTERNAL DATA SOURCE [HelloWorld]
WITH ( 
    LOCATION = 'https://blogmsdemodl.dfs.core.windows.net/blogmsdemofs/Raw/helloworld',
    CREDENTIAL = [WorkspaceIdentity]
)

-- Create View in Synapse
CREATE VIEW kompa AS
SELECT * 
FROM OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'SloveniaTestData.csv',
        DATA_SOURCE = 'HelloWorld',
        FORMAT = 'CSV', 
        FIELDTERMINATOR =',', 
        ROWTERMINATOR = '\n'
    )
WITH (
    [country_code] VARCHAR (5) COLLATE Latin1_General_BIN2,
    [country_name] VARCHAR (100) COLLATE Latin1_General_BIN2,
    [year] smallint,
    [population] bigint
) AS [r];

-- Check you can Query the View in Synapse
Select * From [dbo].[kompa]

-- Setup Synapse Access for Logic App
CREATE LOGIN [logicappkompa] FROM EXTERNAL PROVIDER
CREATE USER [logicappkompa] FROM LOGIN [logicappkompa]
CREATE USER [logicappkompa] FROM EXTERNAL PROVIDER

GRANT permission  [ ,...n ]    
    ON DATABASE SCOPED CREDENTIAL :: credential_name   
    TO principal [ ,...n ] [ WITH GRANT OPTION ]   
    [ AS granting_principal ]
    
-- Grant the Logic App Service Principal access to use the scoped credential
GRANT REFERENCES ON DATABASE SCOPED CREDENTIAL::WorkspaceIdentity to [logicappkompa];

-- Grant the logic app Service Principal access to query the view
GRANT SELECT ON OBJECT::[dbo].[kompa] TO [logicappkompa] 

SELECT  top 1 [AR_base_64_coded]
 FROM [dbo].[kompa]

select sp.name as login,
       sp.type_desc as login_type,
       sl.password_hash,
       sp.create_date,
       sp.modify_date,
       case when sp.is_disabled = 1 then 'Disabled'
            else 'Enabled' end as status
from sys.server_principals sp
left join sys.sql_logins sl
          on sp.principal_id = sl.principal_id
where sp.type not in ('G', 'R')
order by sp.name;

DECLARE @json NVARCHAR(MAX);
SET @json = N'[
  {"id": 2, "info": {"name": "John", "surname": "Smith"}, "age": 25},
  {"id": 5, "info": {"name": "Jane", "surname": "Smith"}, "dob": "2005-11-04T12:00:00"}
]';

SELECT *
FROM OPENJSON(@json)
  WITH (
    id INT 'strict $.id',
    firstName NVARCHAR(50) '$.info.name',
    lastName NVARCHAR(50) '$.info.surname',
    age INT,
    dateOfBirth DATETIME2 '$.dob'
  );


  SELECT TOP 100
    /*Scalar attributes extraction using JSON_VALUE*/
      JSON_VALUE([jsonContent], '$.id') AS [id]
    , JSON_VALUE([jsonContent], '$.first_name') AS [first_name]
    , JSON_VALUE([jsonContent], '$.last_name') AS [last_name]
    , JSON_VALUE([jsonContent], '$.email') AS [email]
    , JSON_VALUE([jsonContent], '$.gender') AS [gender]
    , JSON_VALUE([jsonContent], '$.ip_address') AS [ip_address]
    , JSON_VALUE([jsonContent], '$.stores_purchased_at') AS [stores_purchased_at]
    /*Scalar attributes extraction from a nested array of objects via OPENJSON and JSON_QUERY*/
    , [NestedArray].[nested_record_id]
    , [NestedArray].[nested_record_Name]
FROM
    OPENROWSET(
        BULK 'https://mydatalakename.dfs.core.windows.net/rawdata/MockJSONData/MOCK_DATA-SingleObjectWithNestedArray.json',
        FORMAT = 'CSV',
        FIELDQUOTE = '0x0b',
        FIELDTERMINATOR ='0x0b',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '0x0b'
    )
    WITH(
        [jsonContent] varchar(MAX) /*This now contains the full JSON document from the file. Note the datatype is varchar(MAX).*/
    ) AS [result]
CROSS APPLY OPENJSON 
    /*Use JSON_QUERY here because we are querying a nested array, so we cant use JSON_VALUE.
    We perform JSON_QUERY on the [result].[JSONDocument] field since that is the column with the full JSON Document we want to extract dat from. 
    The path to the attribute is using the normal path to the attribute name that contains the array */
    (JSON_QUERY([jsonContent], '$.attribute_with_nested_array')) /*Note, if you want only the top most record from this array, replace this line with "(JSON_QUERY([jsonContent], '$.attribute_with_nested_array[0]'))"*/
WITH(
    [nested_record_id] varchar(255) '$.nested_record_id',
    [nested_record_Name] varchar(255) '$.nested_record_Name'
) AS [NestedArray]



SELECT TOP 100
    *
from openrowset(
        bulk 'data/data.json',
        data_source = 'FrostRAW',
        format = 'csv',
        fieldterminator ='0x0b',
        fieldquote = '0x0b'
    ) 
    WITH(
        [jsonContent] varchar(MAX) /*This now contains the full JSON document from the file. Note the datatype is varchar(MAX).*/
    ) AS [result]
CROSS APPLY OPENJSON 
    /*Use JSON_QUERY here because we are querying a nested array, so we cant use JSON_VALUE.
    We perform JSON_QUERY on the [result].[JSONDocument] field since that is the column with the full JSON Document we want to extract dat from. 
    The path to the attribute is using the normal path to the attribute name that contains the array */
    (JSON_QUERY([jsonContent], '$.data')) /*Note, if you want only the top most record from this array, replace this line with "(JSON_QUERY([jsonContent], '$.attribute_with_nested_array[0]'))"*/
WITH(
    [nested_record_id] varchar(255) '$.sourceId',
    [nested_record_Name] varchar(255) '$.referenceTime'
) AS [NestedArray]


select
    sourceId, referenceTime
from openrowset(
        bulk 'https://dlsingraphic01.blob.core.windows.net/raw/data/data_test1.json',
        format = 'csv',
        fieldterminator ='0x0b',
        fieldquote = '0x0b',
        ROWTERMINATOR = '0x0b'
    ) with (doc nvarchar(max)) as rows
    cross apply openjson (doc, N'lax $.data')
    WITH ( 
        sourceId varchar(20),   
        referenceTime datetime
 )  ;

library(tidyverse)
library(notebookutils)

# Insert your own client ID here
client_id_secret <- mssparkutils.credentials.getSecret("FrostAPISecrets", "FrostAPI1", "AzureKeyVault1")

# retrieve the job-id from the Spark environment 
jobId <- mssparkutils.env.getJobId()

# Mount folder for saving raw json files
mssparkutils.fs.unmount('/raw') 
mssparkutils.fs.mount('abfss://raw@dlsingraphic01.dfs.core.windows.net','/raw')

# Use this to get json from Notebook
# Define endpoint and parameters and get data
endpoint <- paste0("https://", client_id_secret, "@frost.met.no/observations/v0.jsonld")
sources <- 'SN18315,SN44640,SN50570,SN10380'
# elements <- 'mean(air_temperature P1D)'
elements <- 'mean(air_temperature P1D),min(air_temperature P1D),max(air_temperature P1D),min(air_temperature P1Y),max(air_temperature P1Y)'
qualities <- 0
referenceTime <- paste0('2010-08-01/', Sys.Date())
# Build the URL to Frost
url <- paste0(
    endpoint, "?",
     "sources=", sources,
    "&referencetime=", referenceTime,
    "&elements=", elements,
    "&qualities=", qualities
)

# Issue an HTTP GET request and extract JSON data
xs <- try(jsonlite::fromJSON(URLencode(url),flatten=T))

# Write raw json
# Read json file from adls
write(jsonlite::toJSON(xs), paste0("/synfs/", jobId, "/raw/data/data.json"))

# Data cleaning 
df <- df %>% mutate(time = referenceTime %>% as.Date(format = "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.000Z")) %>% 
        select(sourceId, time, elementId, value) %>%
        mutate(sourceId = gsub(":0", "", sourceId))
dfSpark <- createDataFrame(df)
write.df(dfSpark, path = 'abfss://business@dlsingraphic01.dfs.core.windows.net/data', source = "parquet", mode = "overwrite")

# Libraries needed (pandas is not standard and must be installed in Python)
import requests
import pandas as pd
from notebookutils import mssparkutils
from datetime import date

# Insert your own client ID here CHECK
client_id = mssparkutils.credentials.getSecretWithLS("AzureKeyVault1", "FrostAPI1")

endpoint = 'https://frost.met.no/observations/v0.jsonld'
parameters = {
    'sources': 'SN18315,SN44640,SN50570,SN10380',
    'elements': 'mean(air_temperature P1D),min(air_temperature P1D),max(air_temperature P1D)',
    'referencetime': '2018-04-01/' + str(date.today()),

import json
# Issue an HTTP GET request
r = requests.get(endpoint, parameters, auth=(client_id,''))
# Extract JSON data
json_data = r.json()

# Serializing json and write to raw folder
json_object = json.dumps(json_data, indent=4)

# Check if folder exist, if not create
mssparkutils.fs.mkdirs('abfss://raw@dlsingraphic01.dfs.core.windows.net/' + date.today().strftime('%Y-%m'))

# Write the json_object
mssparkutils.fs.put('abfss://raw@dlsingraphic01.dfs.core.windows.net/' + date.today().strftime('%Y-%m') + 
    '/json_' + date.today().strftime('%Y-%m-%d'), json_object, True)

# Check if the request worked, print out any errors
if r.status_code == 200:
    data = json_data['data']
    print('Data retrieved from frost.met.no!')
else:
    print('Error! Returned status code %s' % r.status_code)
    print('Message: %s' % json_data['error']['message'])
    print('Reason: %s' % json_data['error']['reason'])

# This will return a Dataframe with all of the observations in a table format
df = pd.DataFrame()
for i in range(len(data)):
    row = pd.DataFrame(data[i]['observations'])
    row['referenceTime'] = data[i]['referenceTime']
    row['sourceId'] = data[i]['sourceId']
    df = df.append(row)

df = df.reset_index()

# These additional columns will be kept
columns = ['sourceId','referenceTime','elementId','value']
df2 = df[columns].copy()
# Convert the time value to something Python understands
df2['referenceTime'] = pd.to_datetime(df2['referenceTime'])
df2.rename(columns = {'referenceTime':'time'}, inplace = True)
df2["sourceId"] = df2["sourceId"].replace(':0', '', regex=True)
%%pyspark
dfSpark = spark.createDataFrame(df2)
dfSpark.write.parquet('abfss://business@dlsingraphic01.dfs.core.windows.net/' + date.today().strftime('%Y-%m') +
'/' + date.today().strftime('%Y-%m-%d'))
